src.utils.constants module¶

src.utils.logs module¶

class src.utils.logs.Logs(loggingFile, maxLogs)[source]¶

Bases: object

A logging system, that formats logs according to their severity.

SEVERITY¶

The logs severity in an easier to write way

Type:

enum

MIN_NUM_LOGS¶

The minimum number of logs allowed

Type:

int

MAX_NUM_LOGS¶

The maximum number of logs allowed

Type:

int

LOG_TYPE¶

The type of log. ROUTINE_START and ROUTINE_END mean that the log delimits the start and end of a routine. SUBROUTINE_START and SUBROUTINE_END mean that the log delimits the start and end of a subroutine. OTHER means it’s a regular log

Type:

enum

ROUTINE_STATUS¶

START means the start of a routine (or subroutine) and END means the end of a routine (or subroutine)

Type:

enum

class LOG_TYPE(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)¶

Bases: Enum

OTHER = 7¶
ROUTINE_END = 2¶
ROUTINE_START = 1¶
SUBROUTINE_END = 4¶
SUBROUTINE_START = 3¶
SUBSUBROUTINE_END = 6¶
SUBSUBROUTINE_START = 5¶
MAX_NUM_LOGS = 100000¶
MIN_NUM_LOGS = 100¶
class ROUTINE_STATUS(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)¶

Bases: Enum

END = 2¶
START = 1¶

Bases: Enum

writeNewRunLog(message)[source]¶

Write a log, which is a new run of the file.

Parameters:

message (str) – The log message

writeRegularLog(severity, message)[source]¶

Write a regular log to a file, according to its severity.

Parameters:

  • severity (enum) – The severity of the log

  • message (str) – The log message

writeRoutineLog(message, routineStatus)[source]¶

Write a routine log to a file, according to its routine status.

Parameters:

  • message (str) – The log message

  • routineStatus (enum) – START means the start of a routine and END means the end of a routine

writeSubroutineLog(message, routineStatus)[source]¶

Write a subroutine log to a file, according to its routine status.

Parameters:

  • message (str) – The log message

  • routineStatus (enum) – START means the start of a subroutine and END means the end of a subroutine
